intro: Asphodeline baytopiae, commonly known as the Baytop's asphodel, is a striking plant native to the mountainous regions of Turkey. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its tall, upright stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of striking white or pale purple flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy addition to rock gardens or alpine landscapes. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
